title: Game State and Spatio-temporal Action Detection in Soccer using Graph Neural Networks and 3D Convolutional Networks
author: Jeremie Ochin (Centre for Robotics, MINES Paris - PSL), Guillaume Devineau (Footovision), Bogdan Stanciulescu (Centre for Robotics, MINES Paris - PSL), Sotiris Manitsaris (Centre for Robotics, MINES Paris - PSL), ...
relevance_why: The integration of structured game state information via Graph Neural Networks could enhance techniques for contextualizing audio or speech-related tasks by accounting for relationships and dynamics in team sports.
background: The study focuses on automating spatio-temporal action detection in soccer, integrating visual data and contextual game state to identify player actions more accurately.
contribution: This paper introduces a method combining visual features and local game state information using Graph Neural Networks, achieving improved action detection accuracy in soccer.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing spatio-temporal action detection methods primarily rely on visual features without considering the interactions between players.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by incorporating information on player positions and velocities, structured through Graph Neural Networks, which enhances understanding of player behaviors.

key_innovation: The method uniquely combines visual features with a graph-based representation of players' spatial configurations, facilitating richer context in action detection.
real_world_impact: This approach can revolutionize sports analytics by providing more accurate and automated insights into player performance and tactics, subsequently assisting coaching decisions.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.spatio-temporal action detection: **Spatio-temporal action detection** refers to identifying and localizing actions in videos over both spatial dimensions (where they occur) and temporal dimensions (when they happen).
new_terms.Graph Neural Networks: **Graph Neural Networks** are a class of neural networks designed to work with data structured as graphs, enabling the modeling of complex relationships and interactions.
